div1.p: Service rendered the late Minister Moses A. Hopkins.
Service rendered the late Minister President and Consul General Moses A. Hopkins prior to his death. Attendance upon him during illness. Compensation for the same.
Hon T. F. Bayard Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to refer you to my despatch No. 29 dated 29th of Sept 1886. of which I had before written for compensation for service rendered the late Minister President and Consul General Moses A. Hopkins prior to his death.
I attended upon him during his illness-- I was

was the writter of his invoices when he was unabled to write-- I performed the duties of this Consulate General before the Department of State gave me poower to act according to the Consular Regulations; therefore I feel I should be compensated for part of the quarter ending June 30, 1886 and also for the month of July for service rendered the United States Government, I do not wish to be unreasonable nor do I wish to receive payment for service not justly rendered

rendered; but I am sure if the late Minister Moses A. Hopkins had have lived I would have received my pay. I want to do what is right and just. I submit the above for your consideration and will be willing to abide by what you think is just.
I have the honor to be , Sir, your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier U.S. Vice Consul Genl at Monrovia, Li.
